covered: Happy-path deletions with valid account: multiple scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC20) covering standard 204 response and default behaviors
Comprehensive optional parameter coverage: per-parameter (TC04), all-true (TC02), all-false (TC03), two-parameter combinations (TC05)
Idempotent behavior for already closed and non-existent accounts (TC11, TC12)
Edge cases: account with no subscriptions/invoices (TC06) and large dataset (TC07)
Input validation and auth edge cases: invalid accountId format (TC08), missing CreatedBy header (TC09), missing/invalid authentication (TC10)
Security considerations: SQL injection in accountId (TC15) and XSS in header value (TC16)
Timeout and retry behavior for transient failures (TC17)
Concurrency and performance: concurrent deletions across accounts (TC18)
Regression tests: unpaid invoices write-off (TC19) and backward compatibility without optional headers (TC20)
Documentation accessibility: API docs and error response readability (TC21)
Handling of extra, unsupported query parameters (TC13)
gaps: Authorization: no explicit test for 403 Forbidden when a user is authenticated but not allowed to close accounts
Explicit 404 semantics for non-existent resources not tested (tests currently expect 204 in non-existent case) and need clarification on expected REST behavior
Race condition testing for two clients attempting to close the same account concurrently
Validation of boolean query parameter values beyond true/false (invalid types) not tested
recommendations: Add a dedicated test for 403 Forbidden when an authenticated user lacks permission to close accounts
Add rate-limiting (429) tests and throttling scenarios to verify resilience under burst traffic
Add caching header tests (ETag/Cache-Control) for delete responses where applicable
Add explicit 404 test for non-existent accounts to validate standard REST semantics or confirm 204 idempotence behavior
Add a race-condition test for closing the same account concurrently to ensure proper synchronization
Add negative tests for invalid boolean values in optional parameters (e.g., cancelAllSubscriptions=notABool)
Add tests to verify soft-delete semantics in the data layer (beyond simply marking the account as closed) if relevant to the domain
